title: Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo for Damaged Hair With ProteinFusion Keratin Protein, Black Rice, Silicone-Free 33.8 oz

reviews.review_text: I decided to order the Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo and Conditioner for severely damaged hair cause I was having a lot of hair breakage and shedding and I absolutely resented hair wash days. My hair was brittle and seemed always dry no matter what products I would put on it. I thought that I would have had to cut my hair and start completely over. However, when my products arrived, I could not wait to give them a try. I love the smells. Very nice and not powerful. I washed my hair twice with the Nexxus Shampoo, first time just the scalp, and the second wash, the hair itself. The way that my hair reacted to this shampoo was breathtaking! My curls appeared and believe it or not, I was able to pull a comb through my thick, natural, 4C  hair!! I have never, ever been able to do this before while washing. Barely any hair was coming out in my comb! I had not even used the conditioner yet. I just had to stop and look in the mirror and talk to myself saying, "Omg, I cannot believe this"! I have never, ever experienced a shampoo doing my hair like this before. After I completely rinsed the shampoo from my hair, I moved on to the Nexxus Conditioner. Even more amazing. It stated to leave on the hair for 3 min, but I sat under a hooded dryer for about 10min with the conditioner on my hair, under a plastic cap. Once my time was up, I rinsed away all of the conditioner. My hair was so manageable!! I was able to comb and section it to do my bantu knots and allow my hair to dry overnight. After washing my hair, it only took me about 30 min to get it  all done to dry. I have never been able to complete this process this quickly before! I am highly satisfied with these products! Even though they are  expensive products, I'm hooked and will be purchasing again. I told my mom about my experience and am ready to try it on her hair also, to see if she gets the same experience and satisfaction that I got. Thank you Nexxus for such wonderful products, and thank you Amazon for carrying them. Definitely a must try on the Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo and Conditioner for Severely damaged hair. This is my first time ever writing a review on a product. That's how pleased I was with these products!!
reviews.review_title: The Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo and Conditioner are amazing products

reviews.review_text: I first received this shampoo and conditioner in a beauty box. Out of the hundreds of samples received throughout the years, this was the first product I was compelled to buy. My hair was dry and lifeless. This shampoo/conditioner makes my hair shiny and so soft. I've used more shampoos than I can count and this is the first to give me noticeable results after just one use. I will say that if you are sensitive to perfume smells, this may be too strong for you. I enjoy the sent and the fact that my hair holds that sent beyond 24 hours. Even after using a different shampoo for a day, the smell of this one still comes through. Also, if you are prone to greasy hair, this may make it worse. I do not have this issue typically, but at the end of the day after using this, there is a subtle heaviness to my roots. All of this being said, this is my new favorite beauty product.

Was really hoping to like this, at first I did. Thought it smelled good and my hair looked nice. Read some reviews about it making their hair greasy and I didn’t agree... after a few times using the shampoo and conditioner, my hair looked so oily !!! Also read a review about the scent .. I thought I was nice the first couple of washed but now i think it’s so overwhelming !!! Ugh so now what do I do with the unused product??? Such a waste of money !!

I bought this after getting a sample of both the shampoo and conditioner. It is nothing like I’ve used before. I say that for several reasons … * Texture – the shampoo is thick, but I have had to use more than usual on my hair, and I have medium length hair. * Performance – this actually thickens my hair. I don’t have ultra thin hair, but this adds some bulk to it, more so when my hair is in its “curly” phase. It also makes my hair softer even before adding the conditioner. * Cleanliness – once in my hair, it feels like it never washes out, but it is washed out. My hair does feel cleaner than with the other brands I’ve used, except for my “normal” brand (Garnier Whole Blends – Honey Treasures) which always feels clean. As far as the “scent”, Keraphix has a soft, pleasant scent. It doesn’t linger too long after the hair is dried, unless you put your hair to your nose. As Nexxus brands are found in salons, this is definitely salon quality. It does most of what it promises, but nothing is 100% accurate or perfect. To date I haven’t found a shampoo (or conditioner) that is 100% perfect and I’ve used all brands out there. I alternate the Keraphix system with another hair care system. I have found that alternating between the two works best for my hair.

I really love this shampoo. I tried it for the first time today. I will say that I was worried at first while I was washing my hair because it felt “heavy” and like my hair would be greasy as someone else in the reviews had stated. I do have thin hair so this is a concern. However what you need to know is that as soon as you put the conditioner on that feeling disappears so make sure you condition all the way to your roots. I know that’s typically not recommended but I believe this shampoo and conditioner are made to treat and repair the entire hair strand. Also, it smells amazing. The thing I would compare the smell to is the Moroccan hair treatment oils that are out there. Very pleasant and it lasts after styling which I like because I love to smell good! If you’re unsure whether you’ll like this shampoo then buy the smaller bottles first. And remember to use the shampoo and conditioner together and your hair will turn out smooth and shiny!

I bought the shampoo and conditioner.. I love the smell and it leaves my hair so soft however it looks greasy when my hair is dry :( I have very thin hair that breaks and is easily tangled after showering and been searching for a great shampoo and conditioner my whole life. Unfortunately this isn't the right one for me .. I'm going to try using the conditioner with a different shampoo to see if it helps with making it look less greasy
reviews.review_title: I love the smell and it leaves my hair so soft ...

reviews.review_text: My hair was severely damaged from over processing by a hairdresser.  I tried Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo hoping for a miracle.  The product is amazing.  My hair felt brittle as if burnt by a fire.  After only one use my hair was almost completely restored.  It looks extremely healthy and is soft to the touch.  I have just ordered the conditioner to go with it.  Thank you for a product that actually works.

This shampoo did not impress me as any better than any cheap drugstore brand, and the scent is REPULSIVE. It has a faintly sour, mildew-y smell.  Have you ever been around a person who does the "no poo" thing and never really washes their hair? Their head smells funky, and that's what this shampoo reminds me of... a hippie ex-boyfriend with gross hair. Since the product was fairly expensive, I tried to get used to the scent and use it daily, but after a couple of weeks, I had to throw it out.  I even tried mixing it with a better-smelling product, but the foul scent overwhelmed that of a nicely-scented lavender shampoo that I added to the bottle, and therefore that shampoo went to waste, as well.

DO NOT BUY THIS. I’ve been using this for 4 months. I bought it to help with my postpartum hair loss. However, my hair is in the worst condition it’s ever been in. My scalp is dry and itchy to the point I have scabs on my head. My hair is frizzy and weird feeling. It looks AWFUL. Here’s how I know it’s the shampoo....when I switch to Biolage after a handful of washes my hair got better. I drink a ton of water and take a boat load of vitamins daily. This shampoo is crap in a bottle. So...if you enjoy scratching your head like you have fleas, occasionally having dandruff, look like a wild one with frizzy hair, and enjoy stringy weird feeling hair....this is for you! If you don’t....go to a better brand.

To start off, I have long, fine, high-porosity, virgin hair. I chose this shampoo because my hair tends to get dry, regardless and LIKES protein. I only wash once or twice a week because it’s what the cosmetologist ordered. Dislikes: this shampoo is THICK. Sometimes the pump gets a little jammed. The smell isn’t as crisp as the other Nexxus shampoos. Despite that, I’ve been using it with the Nexxus Humectress shampoo and my hair is glossy, smooth and manageable. Breakage has gone down. There is no extra build up or gunk on my hair. If your hair is low-porosity and/or doesn’t react well to protein, this may not work well for you. It’s worked well for me and people have been complimenting my hair often!

KERATIN TREATMENT INFUSED WITH PROTEINFUSION: Inspired by Nexxus New York City salon, Nexxus shampoo with Keratin Protein and Black Rice is your new weapon to heal signs of damaged hair. SALON-CRAFTED HAIR CARE: Take the first step to rejuvenated hair with our hair repair treatment for damaged hair. Nexxus Shampoo helps replenish and repair hair, leaving it revitalized and cleansed. THE SCIENCE OF PROTEIN: Nexxus knows hair structure consists of up to 90% protein, so Nexxus scientists use leading-edge research called Proteomics to create its revitalizing hair treatment. The concentrated formula of this hair treatment for damaged hair features our highest level of proteins containing Keratin, Collagen, and Elastin. Nexxus combines black rice with Keratin Protein and other essential nutrients to create clinically proven healthy-looking hair. Salon-crafted with our exclusive PROTEINFUSION blend, it’s part of a unique 4-step process. When complete, signs of surface damage are healed, and hair is smooth, strong and healthy-looking. It’s safe and formulated for color and chemically treated hair. At Nexxus, we believe helping hair return to its optimal state means treating it with protein at high levels. Nexxus scientists set out to find inspiration from precious ingredients that could help seal severely damaged hair. The Nexxus Keraphix Healing System for Severely Damaged Hair heals visible signs of severe hair damage. Along with Nexxus keratin shampoo, try our deep conditioner for damaged hair, and add a gel treatment or revitalizing hair mask. We’ve created possibly our best hair mask: Keraphix Hair Masque for Damaged Hair—our favorite deep conditioning hair treatment. We know that hair is made of almost 90% proteins, which is why we use advanced scientific methods to identify the protein needs of each hair type and create customized formulas with proteins to bring your hair back to life.

title: Tea Tree Special Shampoo, For All Hair Types

reviews.review_text: I just want to comment on several reviews that were written regarding this Tea Tree Special Shampoo. People are saying if it doesn’t have the name “John Paul Mitchell” on the front of the bottle, it’s not the real Paul Mitchell shampoo. If you refer to my pictures you will see that my bottle doesn’t say his name on the front either, BUT it does say it on the back of the bottle. This shampoo is most definitely the real deal. Just saying!

This is the exact same product that I get from my salon. It’s not counterfeit. I get the exact same results as if I would’ve bought the product from my salon but saved a lot of money from Amazon. I have combination oily/dry scalp. It’s the only shampoo that works for my condition. Other shampoo’s have failed irritating and making my symptoms even worse. I think some of the negative reviews are from salon employees trying to discourage people from buying the same product from Amazon instead of buying it from their salon. Thank you Amazon. I’m a satisfied customer.
reviews.review_title: Don’t believe all of the negative reviews!

reviews.review_text: Purchased through Asazi Beauty and the bottle came with a broken cap. The shampoo had a strong chemical smell and didn't have the tingling feeling that the original/ authentic product does. Contacted the seller to understand why and if they are authorized sellers.
reviews.review_title: Purchased through Asazi Beauty and the bottle came with a ...

reviews.review_text: I ordered this product for my husband, who regularly uses this type of conditioner. Typically it smells fresh and minty - this bottle smells rancid. On the packaging there was a label saying they were not responsible for falsely filled bottles, so I did not return it, but it smells quite gross, and I wonder what is really in the bottle.
reviews.review_title: Not sure it is what it says it is...

reviews.review_text: I struggled for years with scalp dermatitis. My hair was falling out, and I itched so bad I'd wake up in the middle of the night and shampoo my hair. And shampoos... I must have tried dozens, and then rotated them. No help. My only caution is that you can use it too often, because it will dry out your scalp. But just vary your schedule. You won't be sorry. The relief was amazing.
reviews.review_title: a lifesaver. or a sanity saver.

reviews.review_text: Didn’t notice it was a 10 floz size, which makes this a rip-off. Also, the cap came damaged making it impossible to take with me on my trips. In the sellers defense, I can tell that this is the real deal, not a fake product as a couple of reviews stated. Also, Amazon has such a hard policy agains counterfeit or deceiving products. If you're OK with the price, it's safe to get the product. Regarding the quality, it's the best product I've used on my head in my whole life. I've tried so many different products and treatments, but all disappointment. Until my hair stylist asked me to give this a try. I've such an oily scalp and this shampoo alone is a full treatment for hair and scalp. I couldn't be more satisfied with the product quality.

I've always loved this shampoo since my stylist suggested it for this weird ponytail sore I used to get on my scalp as a child. Minty and refreshing, with a tingling sensation if you leave it in long enough. washes out the thick hair product I use and leaves my hair feeling light and extra clean. Only used once a week (regular shampoos on the other days)
reviews.review_title: This + Hot shower = a broke girl's aroma therapy

reviews.review_text: Based on the Amazon reviews, I decided to try this Paul Mitchell shampoo.  It was pretty decent shampoo and I liked the tingle.  I had used about 1/3 of the bottle when I saw the same shampoo on sale at a salon.  It was a good price so I got another bottle.  It looked like the same stuff (same bottle, same shampoo color & consistency) but what made me suspicious was the difference in smell. The primary scent of the shampoo from Amazon is tea tree oil (sort of similar to Pine-Sol).  The primary scent of the stuff from the salon is peppermint with a background tea tree oil scent (a much nicer smell overall).  Then I used the salon stuff to wash my hair.  Wow, what a difference.  The salon stuff had a better tingle, it created a much thicker lather, rinsed cleaner, and left my hair with more body. Over the next four days, I tested my theory by washing my hair with the Amazon-bought shampoo one day and the salon-bought shampoo the next day. RESULT: The salon shampoo was FAR superior and I am certain I have been had.  I give the counterfeit shampoo two stars because it wasn't bad, but the real Paul Mitchell shampoo is so much better and I paid for the good stuff. I love Amazon, but they need to get to the bottom of this.  I am willing to donate some of my fake Paul Mitchell shampoo for testing.  Just send me an email.
reviews.review_title: Sadly, this stuff is counterfeit.  The real Paul Mitchell shampoo is fantastic.

reviews.review_text: I ordered a 3oz bottle to see if this product would help my itchy scalp. It helped a little so I ordered a big bottle. After a week or so i noticed a dry patch on my back which looked like eczema. The rash started spreading everywhere on my back, chest, stomach, and then down to my arms and legs. It kept getting worse and worse. I stopped using the shampoo trying to figure out what was causing my rash. It started to improve over the next few weeks. I use the shampoo just once to see if it would come back, and it flared up just after one use! Will never buy this product again. I've had this rash for two months and its taking so long for it to disappear. Who knows what's in this product. There is definitely ingredients in there I cannot pronounce which can't be good for you.

I first bought this product ages ago from my hairdresser, then bought some a couple years ago on Amazon. Unfortunately, although the ingredients have apparently not changed (see photos of new bottle vs old bottle), the proportions and/or quality of them have. The current shampoo is: less tea-tree smelling and more peppermint-y; less subtle in its cooling effect on your scalp; less richly lathering; and far less conditioning. The new stuff cleans well, but really strips your hair, leaving it somewhat dry and in need of conditioning. The older formulation did not do that- it left my hair clean, and feeling like conditioner was unnecessary. So overall, a disappointment, and next time I see my hairdresser, I will ask her about possible replacements. For the price, this stuff used to be "wow," now it's just "meh."
reviews.review_title: Not As Good As It Used To Be

title: Moroccan Argan Oil Shampoo and Conditioner SLS Sulfate Free Gift Set - Best for Damaged, Dry, Curly or Frizzy Hair - Thickening for Fine / Thin Hair, Safe for Color and Keratin Treated Hair

reviews.review_text: I’m naturally a dark brown with red undertones and I have bleached my hair to an almost platinum, so my hair is a little over processed. I’ve washed and conditioned my hair 2x since switching and my hair is already showing a huge improvement. My hair is not near as frizzy, it’s at least 50% softer, and my hair seems fuller not weighted down by conditioner build up. In the past I’ve used other more expensive brands of shampoo and conditioner but nothing gave me these quick of results. Update: my hair has never been healthier and I have never received more  complements on my hair then I do now.

I'm actually really impressed. To be honest, I was super skeptical. I've tried a lot of "natural" products that were just a bold-faced lie or didn't work. I've developed a healthy dose of skepticism. This product surpassed my expectations! My hair: pretty long, down to the middle/small of my back. Not color treated but naturally frizzy, medium curly/wavy and very dry.  The only heat I apply is using a straightener every couple of days on low heat. Maybe once a month I blow-dry. I try to be as good to it as I can otherwise it turns into a pure mess of straw in a rat's nest. 1) INGREDIENTS: The ingredients list is not hiding anything nasty. I looked all of them up on SkinDeep and they all passed the test. Dimethicone and fragrance are the only ones you can get nitpicky about but that's really making a mountain out of a molehill. From what I can tell, the only thing that would be gentler on hair is just washing with water. Other "Sulfate Free" hair products are so saturated with other harmful chemicals that sulfates are the least of your problems. I'd say this product is 99% toxin free. That's more than good enough for me. Actually, it's really amazing. I'm impressed with what they were able to accomplish with so few ingredients and how natural they are. 2) EXPERIENCE: wow. I love my hair after using this. My hair is soft, easy to work with, less tangled and frizzy. It's just healthier! It straightens easier and if I choose to do nothing to it, it's not a mess so horrid that I can't leave the house. Can't really speak for thickening or volume but I didn't get it for that. I am more interested in that it's a toxin free product that actually works. 3) CONS: The only con is that my hair gets greasier faster. I wash my hair every 3-4 days. With this, I'm having to wash a day earlier, every 3 days or so. That's SO minor. But I mention it because if others experience it, understand that this isn't necessarily a bad thing. It means fewer oils are stripped out of your hair to begin with. Also, it feels like a detox period. I'll have to wait to see if it gets better or worse over time. Again, totally minor and actually, to be expected if you've ever tried the "no-poo" approach. 4) FRAGRANCE: What others have said about a clean spa smell is about right. It's not a heavy perfume smell but it's not light and airy. It smells like what you think hair products should smell like. One thing that is distinctive is that it smells high-end. Does that make any sense? Overall, I think I found a shampoo I want to use for the foreseeable future. I'm amazed by ingredients. My hair felt healthier after the first use and has been great every time since then. It's a natural hair system with the convenience rarely found in such products. Again, this is MUCH more than just sulfate-free. It's 99% toxin free. For me, this stuff actually does what it advertises to do and that's a minor miracle in itself. Oh, and the box was really nice :) Throw some wrapping paper around it and it's a ready-to-gift.

I recommend this product to everyone who will listen. Its is AMAZING. I cut alcohol out of my hair products and did my research to find a good shampoo and conditioner replacement and these were it! They are full of great stuff and they are HUGE! So they will last me a long time. A little goes a very long way and I have loooong thick hair. I use 2 pumps of shampoo and concentrate just on my scalp and 2 to 3 pumps of conditioner that I dont put on my scalp at all. I bought a set for me and for my mom, she is also so in love. She has very short and thin hair and is also cutting out alcohol or any other damaging ingredients in her hair products. She works for Paul Mitchell and gets her hair done often so it gets abused! So this set puts a little love back in her hair and we are obsessed with this product! I even shared it on my facebook because people need to know you dont have to break the bank for an amazing quality product!
reviews.review_title: I COULD CRY I LOVE THIS SO MUCH

reviews.review_text: I used the shampoo and conditioner for 2 days and got a very serious, extremely itchy rash on chest, shoulders, and back, which led to an expensive exam and treatment at a dermatologist....THIS SHAMPOO & CONDITIONER IS BADLY TOXIC, and described by other users as cheap chemical crap made in China, NOT ORGANIC, and DOES contain a disguised sulfate, which is counter to the "sulfate free" claim of seller.  Seller should be criminally charged for FRAUD. DO NOT BUY AND USE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES!!!
reviews.review_title: DO NOT BUY  CAUSES TOXIC RASHES

reviews.review_text: I really love this set!  I got it because it is sulfate free, which is needed for my keratin treatment. Before buying this product, I was using another sulfate-free shampoo and conditioner, and I thought I needed a re-treatment on the keratin because my hair was starting to feel frizzy again, even though the keratin treatment was only 2 months old.  After stopping that shampoo and conditioner and buying this new set, I realize that my keratin treatment is still going strong!  It was just the products I was using on my hair that were affecting it.  I am now 3 months post-keratin treatment, and my hair is still feeling smooth and soft.  Highly recommend!

I am 64 years old and have very thick coarse colored hair.  All my life I have struggled with the coarseness (understatement!).  This morning I tried Moroccan Argan Oil Shampoo and Conditioner and I am literally blown away.  My hair is so soft and manageable.  Couldn't be more thrilled!!!!  Couldn't recommend these products more highly!!

Smells amazing. It's like a very clean, subtle smell. Makes my hair feel amazing and not greasy at all. The shampoo and conditioner did leak a bit when I opened the package, but not really a big deal.
reviews.review_title: Smells amazing. It's like a very clean

reviews.review_text: I haven’t used it yet. I bought it for the Moroccan oil and that it said it was organic. Just received it - no where on the bottle does it say it’s organic.  Am considering sending it back unless someone lets me know otherwise regarding the misleading, it seems, advertising.

I love this product and what it does for my hair. Will get back to that in a minute. After using it just a few times, the pump on the conditioner broke and had a difficult time getting the product out because it's so thick.  I was able to contact the distributor, also in Florida, and they couldn't have been nicer. Said they would send me out a replacement. He did immediately and it even arrived a few days earlier than expected. Great customer service!! Ok now about the product. I love that it doesn't have sulfates or a lot of chemicals and is professional strength. I had to let my hair go natural, salt and pepper, after severe allergic reaction to hair dyes two yrs ago. I use products on my hair and face very organic and natural.  Like using coconut oil when styling my hair. I've recently starting adding avocado oil to the shampoo before putting it on my hair. It's helped a lot. My hair is curly, and living in Florida, it could get very frizzy in the summer months. I like to wear it smooth and use a flat iron after drying. The shampoo and conditioner is so moisturizing and would be good for any hair types, but I think especially for us curly gals. I used to get Keratin treatments at the salon a number of years ago, but stopped because of expense and the chemicals. I'm able to get pretty much the same results using this product. Plus these are a large size 16.9 fl.oz each.  I will definitely be purchasing more whenever I run out. Try this for your hair. You won't  be sorry!!
reviews.review_title: Great product to control the frizzies

reviews.review_text: These shampoo and conditioner are saving my hair. I have thin hair and I do highlights and dry it with the hot hairdryer every other day. Since I started using these products, my hair is smooth, no frizz, has good amount of volume to it and looks healthy. I love the smell and feel of the products and the fact that they are sulfate free. I also love that there is a dispenser on top, so that you can get exactly the amount of product you need. The product is not cheap, but you see the results after several uses.
reviews.review_title: Love my hair after using this!

product_data.name: Moroccan Argan Oil Shampoo and Conditioner SLS Sulfate Free Gift Set - Best for Damaged, Dry, Curly or Frizzy Hair - Thickening for Fine / Thin Hair, Safe for Color and Keratin Treated Hair
product_data.short_description: About this item MOROCCAN ARGAN OIL SHAMPOO AND CONDITIONER SET: Hydrates and restores moisture levels. Safe and Healthy for Colored & Keratin Treated Hair. Contains a UV and Thermal Protectant with Vitamins and Antioxidants, that Nourish and Repair hair from daily use of a blow dryer, straight iron or curling iron, or chemically treated hair. reviews.review_text: This product may be classified as unscented, but there is definitely a strong smell with it. This sunscreen smells like rubbing alcohol mixed in with other chemicals. To me, It has a very strong distinct chemically smell that makes me cough and my eyes water.  When it dries on my skin the smell dissipates, but the finish is very shiny.  It's too shiny.. I kind of look like a glazed doughnut in the sun with it on. It also has a very thin watery texture that makes me question if it is really effective against the sun. It is very easy to spread all over the skin and doesn't leave a white cast. One thing I noticed that once it dries if I touch or rub my face, the product gums up and turns into little sticky balls that look like boogers  all over my face. I don't put any other products on my face in the mornings, just lotions at night so perhaps there is some mixing of products that caused this. I would not use this product with anything else. Maybe that would help prevent this problem? I have very sensitive skin and this product did not make me break out or turn red so that's good—but I just can't get over the smell of this product. I feel like the strong smell can't be good to put on my face. Another concern I had is that there are no ingredients or instructions written in English, even though the front of this product is entirely in English. I was unable to verify any of the sunblocks ingredients.
It's a really good touch-up during a day. White color. It fits for my fair skin.

I’ve been looking for a sunscreen for a while now. I’ve tried both drugstore and high end. It checks all my boxes. It doesn’t sting my eyes within 10 seconds of applying it. I have medium olive skin, I’m at my darkest summer tan, and there’s no white cast. It doesn’t smell or leave stickiness on my face. And *fingers crossed* it hasn’t broken me out.
Melts onto the skin and as someone with medium-dark skin I love that it doesn't leave any white residue. My new go-to sunscreen!
I love how it applies to my skin and yes it’s brown skin friendly and leaves no white cast!!! Love it!
reviews.review_title: Brown skin friendly and very light on skin!

reviews.review_text: It’s light and milky. Absorbing and covers well. No sticky or white left over the skin

So far one of my favorites! Melts in easily, no white cast at all, moisturizing but dries down so you aren’t left feeling greasy. And so far it hasn’t burned my eyes like most other facial sun creams do!
Five stars for the ingredients. Good👍

title: Free & Clear Hair Shampoo | Fragrance, Gluten and Sulfate Free | For Sensitive Skin | 12 Ounce

reviews.review_text: I have mixed feelings about this product. First things first - it's been great for my sensitive skin and scalp. For most of my life, I've had red/itchy skin despite trying all sorts of high end, expensive products targeted towards sensitive skin, It was only last year (after 10 years of skin abuse) that I realized the culprit for my blotchy/red skin was the shampoos I was using. I tried a few other shampoos which didn't have any impact on improving my skin, but within 1-2 washes of using this product - I could see the perpetual blotches on my face clearing up because of finally not being irritated by harsh chemicals. This shampoo has been great for my sensitive skin, and does not break me out at all. Now for the "not so great" parts - a) This shampoo does not suds well at all, which makes application difficult. It takes a lot of product for me to ensure I clean all of my scalp, because it's difficult to spread around. I know that generally sulphate-free shampoos don't sud, and given how "clean" this shampoo is with it's ingredient list - I can live with the trade-off - but purchase this product with clear expectations. b) Extremely drying - I absolutely can NOT use this product without a conditioner. It leaves your hair feeling "squeaky clean" which is not necessarily a good thing. IMO, I will continue to use this shampoo for a long time as my go-to and will continue to repurchase, but I will also keep experimenting with other shampoos that are not as drying for my fine, thin hair.

Like a lot of other people using this product, I have issues with eczema, skin sensitivity, scalp sores, bumps, itching, dryness, and weird nightmarish rashes that pop up from time to time. Ugh. The scalp problem has driven me nuts until I finally admitted I had a problem and decided to try a hypoallergenic shampoo. This one had good reviews and was safe for my color-treated hair, so I placed an order. After just a few uses, my scalp bumps and sores are FINALLY going away. I'm sold! You will definitely need to use conditioner with this shampoo. It does not produce a lot of lather, but it gets your hair and scalp squeaky clean and is safe on sensitive skin. I think the price for this shampoo is reasonable and the relief it's providing is well worth it. I can live without scented hair.

Works well and doesn't trigger my asthma the way that strongly scented shampoos do.  While this shampoo is not scented, that doesn't mean that the ingredients have no smell at all. They do have a smell, but it is mild and not irritating to me. Note that this shampoo does not lather well when first applied to oily hair. If you rinse and repeat with the same amount of shampoo, it lathers generously the second time.
reviews.review_title: Good option for people with a sensitivity to strong fragrances.

reviews.review_text: Contrary to a couple of reviews, this shampoo had plenty of suds and washed out easily. Also, it did not leave my hair dry. (I bought the conditioner, just in case I notice a problem with dryness...) I have normal hair, it's grey, I'm 72.  A couple of years ago, I started reacting to most shampoos - very itchy scalp. Saw this brand after researching on the internet.  I have used it for a couple of weeks and my head is not itching as much as with most types of shampoo that I have tried.

Is it perfect? No. But it works. It cleans without causing or perpetuating reactions. It contains no fragrance or masking fragrance ingredients, nor any plant extracts that are anything but hypoallergenic. It is fairly harsh and stripping. However, it is better than using fragrance free dish liquid to wash your har because that's the only thing you can find. I have fine hair, and if I use actual soap it becomes a giant sticky snarl. Detergent based cleansers work better for me. I'd use the conditioner too, but it makes my scalp itch.
reviews.review_title: Nice, plain chemicals without unnecessary plant extracts

reviews.review_text: My dermatologist recommended this shampoo after I developed contact dermatitis of unknown cause.  She thought my shampoo (John Paul Mitchell Tea Tree and Lemon Sage Thickening Shampoo) might be the culprit.  I have been using the Free and Clear Shampoo and Conditioner for a month and my dermatitis has not returned.  However my hair is dryer and less manageable than before.  It does the job however and I do recommend it if you develop and allergy to your shampoo.
reviews.review_title: No irritants but a little drying

reviews.review_text: I was surprised to find that this shampoo made my scalp very itchy after a couple days the way chemically scented shampoos do. My hair was also getting dandruff, which it never does with other products. I have been using Earth Science shampoo for many years, which I love, but I felt like it was stripping my hair color. I think this shampoo strips the hair color less, but my scalp gets too irritated.

If I could give negative stars I would. I have soap, shampoo, and detergent sensitivities. I bought this because it looked promising for someone like me who is in need of relief from the constant irritation I live with from over the counter shampoos. Within 3 days of use I had a massive angry rash all over my scalp, ears, and neck. Thinking that maybe it could have been something else that caused such a severe reaction, I waited a month and last night tried to use it again... the rash is back.  This stuff is getting poured down the drain. Clearly it's the shampoo. While over the counter shampoos cause me itching and irritation, they never gave me a massive angry rash!!! There is an ingredient in this shampoo that those with skin allergies or sensitivities should PROCEED WITH CAUTION if they choose to use.  I for one, don't recommend it and warn others to think twice before buying and using.

Although I like & use other Vanicream products, this shampoo did not at all work for me. It was AWFUL since my hair became tangled as soon as I started to lather it, & it felt extremely harsh & drying. I thought my hair would fall out! I immediately rinsed it & used another shampoo. What’s missing in this product is a little conditioning agent. I’ve found in trying natural shampoos  that the cleansers are hard on the hair & must include some kind of moisturizer in it. I do not recommend this product. A couple of good alternatives are Paula’s Choice & Honest brand. Paula’s gets your hair squeaky clean, &  also leaves it incredibly soft but not flat. Although pricey it’s worth it. Honest brand is also very good, but it didn’t give a squeaky clean.  It does a good job though & moisturized without flattening. Highly recommend both of those brands.

I started using this shampoo, as well as their conditioner and hair spray about 5 years ago after developing major skin sensitivities. After years of suffering from dandruff, scalp sores, rashes and such, I finally learned about this product which changed my life for the good. I am so thankful to have found this. The product itself is clear. It has no scent, however a very very minor chemical odor. Not enough to bother me or notice when using it. It has a wonderful lather, and creates lots of suds. It rinses out completely and leaves the hair slick and clean feeling. My stylist has used it when I've brought it to the salon for her to use on me, and she commented on how the product is very nice and what a great job it's doing in my hair, considering it's not a "salon" product like she sells. I have not had any issues with skin sensitivity with this shampoo and am glad to have an option like this.
reviews.review_title: Seriously sensitive skin - and NO ISSUES using this!

title: L'Oreal Paris Elvive Total Repair 5 Repairing Shampoo for Damaged Hair Shampoo with Protein and Ceramide for Strong Silky Shiny Healthy Renewed Hair 28 Fl Oz

reviews.review_text: I am embarrassed to say that I have some ridiculously expensive hair care products from Bergdorf and Neiman's. They don't hold a candle to this Elvive line. Save yourself hundreds and try this.

I LOVE this conditioner. As a former cosmetologist and someone with color treated/damaged hair, I'm careful about what I use on my hair. If I use products that are too harsh my hair will go from shiny and silky to straw-like and easily breakable. This conditioner works with any shampoo I use our after I have used a harsh chemical on my hair. My hair has never felt softer or more resilient after styling.

My hair had been dry, damaged, broken and processed for the passed 6+ months.  As a result of a busy life, stress, too much coloring and straightening and plain laziness when it comes to conditioning, my hair changed from lustrous and long to dry, brittle, broken and dull.  I was mortified when I finally really LOOKED in the mirror and saw the condition of my hair. I decided to try Elvive Total Repair 5 instead of buying a more expensive brand (budgeting!!) after reading about how great it's supposed to be.  WELL>>>>  OMG!!  My beautiful hair is back!!  After one go with shampoo and conditioner... my hair came back to me!!  My ends look great, my hair is soft and bouncy, shines like glass in the sunlight.  I am so thrilled, I can't even say!! Sorry for not having any photos - I just wanted to give a quick review because I found my new hair product.  Who needs the salon ($$ and time) when I can do this myself at home.  THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU, L'Oreal for making this product.  It's a fantastic little secret that needs to be shared!

I got a small sample of this at Walgreens not thinking much of it and it changed my hair's life! I got this sample about 3 years ago and I have used nothing else since.  I also use with the balm and it is #hairgoals.  It makes my hair bouncy and beautiful.  I have colorful hair, it is blue at the moment and I also use Overtone Deep Coniditioner (it has blue color in it and i use it to keep my hair vibrant as opoosed to colorng it every week I just use this).  So I started slacking on using the Loreal conditioner since it wouls take more time to do both.  THEN after about 3 weeks I used the Loreal again and I was really confused  as to why my hair looked so amazing!  I was like what did I do different? So I put two and two together and long story short I will always use this conditioner since it makes my hair so bouncy and wonderful.  Plus its cheap! Buy it people your hair will thank you!
reviews.review_title: The only conditioner I will use!

reviews.review_text: Love this when my 57yr old hair needs extra TLC. I can imagine how great it is for the younger peeps using it. Soft soft soft!

I had been using a deep conditioner due to my color treated hair and was disappointed in the results. Bought this on a whim and I immediately noticed a difference. My hair is long, fine, and stick straight. I dye it blonde about every other month. It has gotten really dry on the ends...or so I thought. Turned out I just needed a conditioner like this. No more frizz or "dry bleached hair" look.
This stuff feels and smells great and doesn't weigh down my fine yet curly hair.
reviews.review_title: My favorite shampoo & conditioner; great for curly hair

reviews.review_text: Do Not Buy Dis It broke My hair off so bad where it began to Fill out so bad, Dried my hair out, burnt my scalp Hair became very scabby in painful.. also burnt my ear up
reviews.review_title: It’s Not Good at all The shampoo nor conditioner

reviews.review_text: Please be wary of the unpronounceable chemicals contained in all L'Oreal Paris Elvive Total Repair 5 products. Up until last December, Amazon and many other sites were forced to display a Prop 65 warning in the item description section. This states that this product may contain lead and can cause birth defects. As of 2021 all evidence of this warning has been removed. I highly recommend staying safe and buying anything else. Consumers have a right to know and if this gets removed I’m going extremely public.

Love this line of products. My hair was amazing after 1 wash, and treatment. I bought it all and I love it all. My hair was so dry and damaged and I could tell the difference within 1 week of using all the products... Highly recommend this product line.
reviews.review_title: Love this New Product Line! Awsome!!

title: BIOLAGE Hydrasource Shampoo | Hydrates & Moisturizes Hair | For Dry Hair | Paraben & Silicone-Free | Vegan​

reviews.review_text: Too good to be true. This is not the real product or Matrix has changed their formula. The bottle on the left I purchased at a beauty supply shop, the label is a vibrant color and the product is a think cloudy color. The bottle purchased here (on the right) the label is a dull looking color and the liquid is a clear color. My hair is dull and does not hold style like it does using the product bought at the beauty supply store. It smells somewhat the same but something is not right. This is only my two cents, and my experience.

I just ordered my second bottle of the 33-oz Hydrasource shampoo. It has lasted me 6 months with every-other-day washing, and I have long and thick hair. It keeps my hair hydrated whether I wash-and-go (which I do most often) and it doesn't get greasy the next day, or if I blow dry. I've used this shampoo for over a decade and even if I switch it up I always come back to it. I have used all kinds of other shampoos, salon and otherwise, but this is always my tried and true. It is important to note that there are TWO kinds of Hydrasource shampoos – Ultra Hydrating which states on the bottle that it is for Very Dry Hair, and Hydrasource which states on the bottle that it is for Dry Hair (not very dry). They are both legitimate products and I have bought both over the last I’d say 12 years. The product is cloudy and not clear. If you have a clear product you will need to return or exchange it. As long as I've been buying the product from several sources - Walmart, Amazon, CVS, and eBay - I have never come across clear shampoo.
reviews.review_title: This is not a fake product

reviews.review_text: This is made in Spain - not the US. This is not the same product you get at Ulta or Target.  It is watery and does not moisturize like the kindness I have bought before.  Surprised they can sell with the same label.
reviews.review_title: It is watery and does not moisturize like the kindness I have bought before

reviews.review_text: My wife is the one that takes care of her hair in our family...cheap was good for me.  She gave me a bottle of hers...I admit, I cannot believe the difference of how much softer and easy to style my hair is....sounds like a commercial huh?  I'm just an ole fart rancher....don't much care what I look like or how my hair feels...cows still love me!

The last few months I've been noticing my hair has been really dry, breaking, and just something didn't feel 'right' after using these products.  I began noticing my shoulders were itchy and breaking out too.  I started thinking about what may be causing it over the last couple of months, and started thinking about this shampoo and conditioner I was using.  I stopped using it for 2 days, instead using regular body wash for my hair and instantly my hair stopped falling out, and my scalp/skin stopped burning. Thinking back, I remember this (and the associated conditioner I got) not having safety seals on them.  Today I received my legitimate replacements from an authorized salon, and BOTH the shampoo and conditioner had safety seals on them - it leads me to believe that whatever is in this product here on amazon is either a fake/knock off product, or someone tampered with it.  I've learned my lesson - I won't be buying anything like this from a non-legitimate salon ever again.  Not worth it.
reviews.review_title: Something is wrong with this stuff - Do not buy!

reviews.review_text: BEWARE! This product is horrific! I'm so upset with this shampoo and what it did to my hair! I was in denial and the same thing was happening to my fiance, this Shampo stripped our hair completely of any and all natural oils..it was like dish soup! Once my scalp was dry it would be stinging slightly like a burn and the next day my scalp would be flaking off! The same happened to my fiance. I then googled this product & the reviews were saying the same exact thing! This CR@P needs to be DISCONTINUED! It says moisturizing on the bottle too, what a joke! I'll stick to my Chi!
reviews.review_title: DON'T BUY, HAIR WILL FALL OUT/SCALP CAME OFF IN CHUNKS

reviews.review_text: I have used Biolage for decades. I assumed this was the Same.  I kept thinking I'd gotten a bad hair cut. My hair was terrible. I have very thick and healthy hair until this product. My hair was very dry and brittle. One day I realized it could be the shampoo.  I changed and a huge difference!  The low price should have been a clue. I've heard that some  Amazon products are the same bottle you recognize filled with. Substandard products.  I love Amazon... I didn't want to believe this and this was proof to me. 😟
reviews.review_title: This is NOT Biolage !  Dried out my hair. Ends were brittle. Don't put this on your hair!

reviews.review_text: I have straight thick and dry hair that is frizzy all year long. The other hydration shampoos meant for this type of hair gives me dandruff  almost immediately.  This is the only shampoo that not only gives me no dandruff but also keeps my hair soft and shiny. There is no build up even if I go forego washing my hair for a week. This is why I am a repeat customer. I use this shampoo and Matrix smoothproof conditioner which works to keep my hair smooth and frizz free.
reviews.review_title: This is the only Shampoo that has me coming back

reviews.review_text: I finally for once in my life had thick hair. Until I started using this shampoo. After I showered using this for a couple weeks my hair was falling out by the brush load.. 3 brush loads to be exact after each time I used it. I’m so devastated to lose all this hair I finally got to grow. THIS DOES NOT MOISTURIZE AT ALL!! I used with the conditioner as well. I’m back to were I was a couple years ago with thin hair. Do yourself a favor and do not buy this. Even if its a good price. Back to $3 shampoo and conditioner that does a WAY better kob!

Absolutely unacceptable! The right bottle, but I don't know what they filled it with! I have used Biolage hydrasource Shampoo for quite some time, but this is not it! This stuff smells disgusting! Absolutely disgusting! The label says it's the right thing, but someone poured out the real shampoo that matches the label and refilled it with something nasty. I had a small amount left in my previous bottle- not from this vendor-and waited until it was empty before I opened  my new bottle. I was stunned! I have bought this once before from Amazon and got the right product and was very happy about my purchase and satisfied. After this experience I will never order my shampoo from Amazon again! So disgusted. And now I have to go purchase another bottle

title: TRESemmé Shampoo for Dry Hair Moisture Rich Professional Quality Salon-Healthy Look and Shine Moisture Rich Formulated with Vitamin E and Biotin 28 oz 3 Count

reviews.review_text: The shampoo is very good with nice smell. It removes oil on hair very well. And the hair smells really fresh with smooth touch. The reasons I only give 4 stars are as follows: 1) It looks the box is updated with new package which does not match the pics on Amazon currently. But I still believe it's the same one. 2) I bought two of them. However, as the pics show, one box looks leaking for a while with white residues along the cap. Overall, it's nice shampoo and I like it!
reviews.review_title: Nice shampoo but pics need update....

reviews.review_text: Not sure if it's 10 yrs old, or the newest. The last one I bought in the store is not like this. Either way, the product you sell should match the picture. The one in my picture is what I received. The one I bought in the store a while back looked like the picture advertised.

I honestly first used this at a family members house and realized that my hair felt much better; softer, less dry, etc.  Then I realized that a spot of psoriasis that flares up occasionally was not bothering me at all.  Since I switched over to this as my regular shampoo, I have not needed dandruff shampoo, medicated shampoo, or conditioner -- although I may try the TRESemmé conditioner.  I highly recommend it.
reviews.review_title: A Nice Surprise -- And Now My New Shampoo

reviews.review_text: When I order a Clarifying Shampoo and get a Moisture Rich Shampoo, it is a major fault although both come in the same Tresemmse bottle, both made by the same company (Tresemme); BUT ONE VERY CLEARLY SAYS MOISTURE RICH while the one I want very clearly says CLARIFYING SHAMPOO.  To me it's the same as receiving a completely different product altogether.  The one I got shampoos okay after which my hair is nice and soft.  But the one I want leaves my hair squeaky clean.  The clarifying shampoo clarifies like it says--it washes off the buildup (residue) of other crap on my hair  since the last wash which includes the molecules of hair conditioner, other stuff for styling purposes (I don't use), sebum (the natural oil from the sebaceous glands in the scalp), any applied hair oil (I don't use), and the dirt which clings better to hair covered with natural or commercial oils.  AFTER CLARIFYING my hair, I can alter the hair any way I want before the next hair wash.  In my case it includes just the right amount of hair conditioner to soften it before I comb it in the style I want.  That's it! I can't help but feel the supplier was out of CLARIFYING SHAMPOO and thought I'd never know the  difference.  No uh uh.  Not so. The supplier can say, "Well why didn't you mail what we gave you back for a refund or replacement?"  Anyone who has a life at all knows the answer to that question. Maybe next time I can find a good clarifying shampoo in a beauty shop, or drugstore, or grocery store.  I would hope maybe I could find some Tresemme Clarifying Shampoo there since I like their shampoo.
reviews.review_title: I ordered the Tresemme Clarifying Shampoo.  I received their Moisture Rich Shampoo.

reviews.review_text: I never thought I would change shampoos until I ordered this in an emergency. It smells good it feels good and it’s comforting. My hair stay shiny. I was really surprised. I’m happy. *** Bonus - Good price!*** And I will order again. Thank you Amazon.com for making this world a little more affordable. :-)

When I bought the shampoo I was thinking that it was big but not, I think you should retake a picture for showing the real size: people will understand because of the prise. This had been helped at me to clean, not be dry or damaged the hair most of the time because I used another like this and really see the difference between others like Head and Shoulder's. I am using still because I really want to see if my hair will be nutrive and soft so far usually its difficult find the right one! The price is cheap from the others because usually Tresemme it's a expensive brande.

I have fairly thick and wavy hair and I bought both the shampoo and conditioner.  I used as directed and it turned my hair into a greasy or dry frizz bomb every time I used the combo.  Even when I put after shower products in.  No shampoo and conditioner combo has ever done this to me and when you look at the ingredient list it's horrifying too.  Most hair dressers in fact would not recommend.  I bought this because it was on the cheaper side but since this is your hair we are talking about it might be better of spending more money.  I can only imagine how damaged my hair would be if I continued use.  I do not recommend purchasing.

I use TRESemme hairspray so I thought I would try this shampoo.  Glad I did. It really is great.  I can actually put a comb or brush through my hair when I get out of the shower and there are no tangles at all.  It makes my hair so soft and I think it's one of the best shampoo's I've ever used.  Better than some of the very expensive brands.  Very happy with this purchase and the price was right for a nice, large bottle.

Since I've tried this shampoo, can't go back to any other, and I've tried a LOT of shampoos/conditioners over the years. This one gets your dry hair silky smooth, soft, and moisturized. Doesn't leave your hair feeling stripped like a lot of shampoos do but also feels like it's cleaning the dirt and oils out. Must say it works better with the matching conditioner. I've recently been using a different conditioner and the results are not as good.

This product caused my hair to come out in clumps!! I hate leaving these kinds of reviews but I pray it helps someone else to avoid the mistake of using this, losing a ton of hair, and finding out when it was almost too late. Find a good sulfate free shampoo. YOU’RE WELCOME!!
reviews.review_title: Caused my hair to fall out in clumps

product_data.product_description: Size: 28 Fl Oz (Pack of 3) When it comes to replenishing moisture to dry locks, use TRESemmé Moisture Rich Shampoo for Dry Hair to restore natural vibrancy for a healthy look and eye-catching shine. TRESemmé wants you to look and feel your best, which is why the TRESemmé Moisture Rich System delivers optimized hydration that targets dryness and locks in moisture where your hair needs it most—every day. Enriched with vitamin E, this gentle shampoo is designed to deliver optimum hydration that targets dryness and seals in moisture. The lightweight formula means you can turn dry, damaged hair into soft, manageable strands with beautiful shine. It’s also safe for colored hair. How to use the Moisture Rich System: Step 1: Coat hair with a liberal amount of TRESemmé Moisture Rich Shampoo. Step 2: Gently massage the scalp and roots with fingertips to work into a lather. Step 3: Lightly squeeze the shampoo from roots to ends and rinse thoroughly. Step 4: Apply an adequate amount of Moisture Rich Conditioner from mid-shaft to ends. Step 5: Run a wide-tooth comb or fingers from roots to ends to detangle and fully coat hair. Leave for 2-3 minutes, then rinse thoroughly. Step 6: Finish with your favorite TRESemmé styling products as desired. Are you looking for a moisturizing shampoo for damaged hair? The clear choice is TRESemmé. Use TRESemmé Shampoo with TRESemmé's salon-quality hair styling products to perfect your look. These professional, salon-quality hair care products are deep conditioning hair products for dry hair without the salon price tag. Hair feeling dull or dry? TRESemmé Moisture Rich Detangling Spray is a conditioning, leave-in detangler that delivers intense nourishment and hydration, giving tresses a beautiful, healthy shine. Or give your hair the deep-rooted moisture it craves. TRESemmé Moisture Rich Deep Conditioning Mask works hard so you don’t have to, delivering intense nourishment that leaves hair looking healthy and happy in just one use. Ever since our origin in salons, TRESemmé has been driven by a simple truth: every woman deserves to look and feel their best, and that usually starts with a good hair day! TRESemmé is dedicated to creating hair care and styling products that are professional quality and promoting the values that defined our inspirational founder, Edna L. Emme — independence, self-reliance, and, most importantly, the confidence you need to step up and meet the next challenge.

title: Nexxus Shampoo and Conditioner for Dry Hair Therappe Humectress Silicone-Free, Moisturizing Caviar Complex and Elastin Protein 33.8 oz 2 Count

reviews.review_text: Be cautious when purchasing these products. The reviews are not just for the Nexxus Shampoo and Conditioner, they are from a wide range of products sold by this seller. I've used Nexxus for a long time and loved the way it makes my hair look and feel. I've never had reactions or issues until ordering from this seller. I broke out in an allergic reaction in multiple attempts at using these products. My hair felt dry and horrible each time as well. Definitely not the same formula. Spend your money at a safe and reputable store to get these products for the same price.

Disclaimer: I really wanted to love this shampoo! At first I thought this was going to be my holy grail shampoo and conditioner. It left my fine hair moisturized but not weighed down. It was only after using it a few more times that I noticed my scalp was very irritated and itchy and TONS of hair kept falling out. Those were two huge red flags for me. As soon as I stopped using the shampoo and conditioner, my scalp felt better, tiny bumps from irritation around my face went away, and my hair stopped falling out in clumps. Do not buy these!

This product did not work for my hair, all it did was dry my scalp & neck. Now I have multiple dry patches that I am trying to get rid of. They almost look like I had a chemical reaction to this product. I will never buy shampoo off of Amazon again, I will go straight to a salon to get my hair products. Waste of money that I wont get back.

Please don't waste your time or money on this knock off... I used this product in my salon years ago when you could only purchase Nexxus from a authorized beauty salon/supplier.. I also have bought just a few months ago from Wal-Mart and I can tell you that the shampoo & conditioner I received is not even the same quality sold in department stores... I use Pureology & was in a bind until I could get to the coast to beauty supply so I purchased this product to use until I made the trip & to keep for emergencies and/or for guest in my home... This is by far one of the worst ever... You cannot rinse the shampoo out of our hair & it leaves a residue... I cannot give this stuff away.. Super Sad as this is not Nexxus quality products!!!
reviews.review_title: Please don't waste your time or money on this knock off

reviews.review_text: I'm 43 yrs old. I've been using nexxus products off & on since I was 11 yrs old. Leaves my hair silky smooth. Works great on curly hair without the nasty buildup. I've bought from this seller 4 times. Same great quality!
One of the tops was not completely closed and leaked all over the inside of the box.

I used to think people were crazy for paying this much for shampoo and conditioner until a friend gave me Nexxus as a gift. I have very bushy, wild, hair that I’ve always put up in a bun because straightening takes too long and doesn’t even last a whole day. The first time I used it I left my hair down and let it air dry. When my boyfriend came home from work he asked me where I was going...I was confused because I hadn’t planned to go anywhere. He said my hair looked very nice and he knew me well enough to know I don’t ever style my hair so I must have been getting ready to go out. I went to look in the mirror and I was shocked. My normally unorganized curly frizz actually had formed into perfect ringlet curls all over. And as any curly haired girl will know, with the lesser brands you have to use so much to get the tangles out, but if you cross the fine line to too much you end up with a greasy look. With this stuff I only use 1 pump of shampoo, and 1 1/2 pumps of condition. It lasts me so much longer than the cheaper brands, so even though it costs more up front, you don’t have to buy as often which means over time you don’t really pay much more than for the cheap stuff. It also smells great all day.

The product seemed to be fine at first, but a couple month later it is starting to dry my scalp out. I had a dry itchy scalp for a couple weeks and my entire face started breaking out as well as chest. My acne has never been this bad and it was itchy as if I had an allergic reaction. I discounted using the product and immediately my scalp was calm in a sense and my face redness went down immediately. I don’t know how or what changed from the first month to the second, but I do not recommend it.

I am writing to inform and compare with any others who have also experienced the same hair loss issues both my 19 year old son and I, his mother have expereinced since using these products.  My son has been getting patches of hair loss/baldness as well as major thinning to the point he looks like a 60 year old man balding.  I also have been worrying about why everytime a take a shower i lose a significant amount of hair, way more then a normal shedding.  An artical and post re hair loss due to tresumme and a preservative DMDM Hydantoin caught my attention.  AS i read further, i noticed nexxus was listed on the list of produts using this ingredient, then confirmed it's in both of these products.  I was thinking it was our water, not sure what but we've had bloodwork done, going to dermatologists and then today i see this post and discover nexxus isn't even nexxus anymore, it was acquired by unilever, same company as Tresumme.  This seems to have some serious credibility and I am so upset these companies can do this to people.  Why does the government allow these companies to hide things and still sell the products.
reviews.review_title: Nexxus Therappe and Humectress hair loss

reviews.review_text: I have been using another product that promised to help repair dry and damaged hair. I thought I loved that product,  until  I  splurged on this combination from Nexxus.  I noticed the difference immediately after one usage.  My long hair felt silky and soft without feeling oily or greasy.  The smell is very pleasant and lasts for a couple of days. I tried going 5 days and that was the limit for me. My hair still felt amazing, but my scalp needed to be freshened up.  It has a very thick consistency and therefore you only need a small amount. Same with the conditioner. I have been using the same bottles for over a month and I'm only a quarter of the way down. This is my new FAVORITE.

LOCK IN MOISTURE, UNLEASH SMOOTH HAIR: With Elastin Protein and Caviar Complex, this shampoo and conditioner will leave your hair feeling silky from morning to night and help retain natural movement. ULTIMATE MOISTURE: Transform your dry locks into smooth and shiny locks, as if you just came from the salon. The Nexxus shampoo and conditioner duo works together to help repair and rejuvenate hair. SALON-CRAFTED HAIR CARE: Nexxus moisturizing shampoo and conditioner helps replenish and repair hair, leaving it revitalized without weighing it down, giving it flexibility and suppleness every day. NEXXUS HAIR CARE PRODUCTS: Repair dry hair with our hair products that are silicone free. Born in salons and perfected by science, using high-performing technology and precious ingredients.
product_data.product_description: Style: Humectress Salon-crafted with Nexxus’ exclusive Caviar & Protein Complex, this shampoo and conditioner pair helps nourish hair and deliver deep hydration, fortifying the surface of hair to lock moisture in for 24 hours. Our Moisturizing Shampoo has a lightweight, silicone-free formula that revitalizes hair without weighing it down, helping to give hair the flexibility and suppleness needed to retain its natural movement. Ultimate Moisture Humectress Conditioner provides advanced conditioning to help replenish and reawaken hair, unleashing your hair’s natural smoothness all day long. Repairing hair is a multi-step process. For best results, apply Moisture Shampoo to damp hair, massaging into a rich lather before rinsing thoroughly. Follow with the Humectress Conditioner, smoothing onto wet hair and waiting 3 minutes before rinsing. For optimized results, use Humectress Hair Masque and finish with Luxe Lightweight Conditioning Hair Mist or Encapsulate Serum to lock in moisture. Both Therappe Shampoo and Humectress Conditioner are suitable for everyday use. A leader in salon-quality hair products, Nexxus uses learnings from science and nature. Nexxus uses advanced scientific methods to identify the protein needs of each hair type and create customized formulas with proteins to bring your hair back to life.

title: Paul Mitchell Awapuhi Shampoo, For All Hair Types

reviews.review_text: Had a salon bought version at home, and this one seemed no different. I am pro trained in Paul Mitchell as well (have my cosmetology schooling from them), and really didn’t have high hopes for this being legit, but it’s the real deal! It’s not any cheaper on here though, so if you can get it from your cosmetologist, do it. I was in a bit of a pinch, and thought I’d give this a try. The original awapuhi is a great classic product in PM, and is a very basic, somewhat gentle sulfate shampoo. This is NOT the black awapuhi sulfate free Paul Mitchell shampoo!! It’s their classic awapuhi shampoo.

so i purchase this shampoo with great expectation and what i received was nothing more than disappointing. Before i  get into it i want to say that amazon doesnt always sells the stuff directly in fact most of the time you are buying from 3rd party vendors, therefore i believe the items i bought might had been from 3rd party vendors but am not sure i havent  really went into looking who exactly the order went thru. nonetheless what i received is watered down. so below  i will be listing the reasons of why i believe this is watered down. 1. scent; the smell of this and most PM products is very nice and overwhelming, what i received lacked any scent and u only really got a taste of it when u put ur nose right into the bottle, and the smell wasn't as good in fact it smelled weird. 2. texture; its way too watery, and the color is mixed pure white and transparent shampoo, those are the main 2 , the rest is quality . when using this product my hair feels rough , i understand this is only shampoo but it leaves the hair way , way too rough even running your hand thru your hair after u wash it feels like running your hand on grass.  i know it doesnt have any conditioner on it, but it leaves ur hair way too rough where even head and shoulders shampoo doesnt leave ur hair like that , let alone an original paul mitchell $22 shampoo. all in all i will be buying another of the other paul mitchell shampoo , not awapuhi and i will make sure that i select amazon as the vendor hopefully itll be the original product and if not i might buy directly from paul mitchell website and make a video comaprison. the only thinh i can say is , if ur gonna buy make sure u select ur vendor as amazon not 3rd party vendors.

Only shampoo I can use that doesn't cause an allergic reaction or make my hair look like electrified straw. Consistently my hair looks very healthy and shiny even without conditioner. It doesn't have as much body to it as I would wish it to have but I have fine hair so I know that's asking a lot of a shampoo. Have tried other shampoos (at least the ones I'm not allergic to off the bat) and even with only a single washing they make my hair look totally fried and flatter than the proverbial pancake. Never happens with this shampoo. With this one, a single washing with the Awapuhi will resurrect my zombie hair from the walking dead. Not sure how it does that amazing feat but I'm not going to question nor complain! The 33 oz size is fantastic for the budget too. Have at times been able to score some pretty good deals when it's gone on special. Big difference in price from getting it at the salon. Bottom line, me and my hair are definitely PM Awapuhi fans for life!
reviews.review_title: My hair looks very healthy and shiny even without conditioner

reviews.review_text: I have very, very fine hair, like glass. But I have a TON of it. This shampoo is light enough not to weigh my hair down, makes it silky smooth, gives me a little volume, and gives me decent second-day hair while smelling subtle and lovely.

After buying a number of shampoos purely for the smell or the "brand" I decided to go back to when my hair looked the best - when my salon only used this shampoo on my head.  Sure enough, the light scent and excellent cleansing properties returned me to this shampoo if I want my hair to look the best. I have shoulder length hair with long layers. My hair texture is a mix of some curly/some straight - so just a mixed bag of lifelessness if I do nothing. My routine is as follows to get the best from your products if you suffer from lifeless hair: 1. Wet hair thoroughly 2. Take only a quarter size of shampoo, rub your hands together and gently massage your scalp. 3. Get some water on your head to create a lather 4. Do not lather your ends 5. Let the water run through your hair until it runs clean 6. Take a cup of half apple cider vinegar and half water and lightly work it through your hair 7. Rinse your hair 8. It should feel "squeaky" which means that your hair is clean (if you use a lot of product, be sure to use a little more shampoo/vinegar until you achieve the squeak. I do not condition because my hair is not dry. I tend to have well-balanced natural moisture in my hair. Lightly condition the ends if you need to and rinse thoroughly. 9. Gently squeeze dry your hair 10. Wait until your hair is lightly dry naturally or lightly dry with blow dryer 11. Take a quarter size styling product into your fingers, not palms. Rub together your fingers and lightly work it through your hair starting at the roots. 12. Continuously fluff your hair with your fingers if you are air drying or now begin using the blow drier to lift it the way you want This routine has worked great for me for a long time. I hope it works for you. Less is more.

Bottle looked the same as Awapuhi, product Looked similar to Awapuhi, but it had a metallic smell. Used once and was sure; This is Not Awapuhi!!! Perhaps some foul smelling substance mixed with half a bottle of Awapuhi at best. BEWARE!!!

I’ve been using it for over 10 years.  I love this shampoo.  A little goes a long way and it does an excellent job.  It I have somewhat oily hair and I wash it everyday.  It does not dry my hair out, just leaves it fresh and clean. The shampoo and lathers really well and rinsed easily.  It has a pleasant slightly botanical scent, not overpowering at all.  Just refreshing.

Updated review November 6, 2020: I didn’t realize I’ve been back to this amazing stuff for over six years. But here we are. And still shiny, bouncy, healthy-looking hair. I’ve run the gamut from short to long hair over the past six years and this shampoo does it all. Love. I now, exclusively, use “The Detangler” for conditioner. And I don’t let it sit. My stylist always comments about how well my 45 year old hair holds moisture. Love. Now, my 9 year old twin boys with long (for boys) curly hair use this same combo. Works great for them, too! Original review May 9, 2014: I used this shampoo in high school and through my early 20's. I always had bouncy, light, shiny, easily styled hair that smelled great.  For whatever reason, around the age of 25, I thought I needed a change and moved on to other brands.  While I could keep a shine in my hair, or bouncy and light, I couldn't do shiny, bouncy healthy looking hair all at once.  As the years went by, my hair just became a little more dull, a little more listless, a little more unmanageable.  Always managed to keep the smelled great aspect as that's always been something important to me. In a random move a couple months ago I thought I'd give my old favorite shampoo a try.  OMG.  I will never use anything else again.  I have learned my lesson!  What I thought was my hair changing with my age and with pregnancies and environment and whatnot was just wrong.  Instantly I had my shiny, bouncy, light, easily styled, smells great hair back.  I am using this shampoo with the extra body rinse as my main conditioner and the detangler conditioner as desired.  My hair is right back to what I remember it being like in high school and my early 20's. Never again will I give up on PM!
reviews.review_title: I thought my hair had changed with my increasing age

reviews.review_text: The scent of this is amazing! I've wanted to try this shampoo for a few years now but could never find it at a decent price. When I first washed my hair with it, it felt weird because of how it cleans all of the old product off of your hair. After your hair is dried, that feeling goes away and It doesn't leave your hair dry or tangly.  As a woman of color with natural hair, it is hard to find a shampoo that works well for me without destroying my hair or scalp in the process but this one works perfectly! I wish I tried it sooner.

For decades (ahem) I have loved Paul Mitchell Awapuhi Shampoo. The scent was heavenly.  I was not a frequent buyer, maybe once every few years.  So I found a deal for this on Amazon.  It came damaged.  Shampoo all leaked in the bag it was in.  They should have also taped the cover.  After cleaning it all off, I tried it, the smell is horrible now.  How can it go from my favorite scent to something so horrible?  Either they changed the formula or it's not official? I don't know.  Things always change. :-(

title: Aussie Miracle Moist Shampoo, and 3 Minute Miracle Deep Conditioner Hair Treatment Bundle, Infused with Avocado & Australian Jojoba Oil, Paraben Free, White, Citrus, 3 Piece Set

reviews.review_text: I am African-American with very thick hair that is mix of all the 4 hair types (A,B,C). I was using the regular Aussie Conditioner as a deep conditioner. It worked well but still did not feel like my hair was moisturized. Probably due to low porosity. Anyhoo, I decided to try the 3 Minute Miracle Moist. Chile...Can I say that here? This stuff really works on my hair. I do a 30 minute deep conditioner (apply tons after shampooing then slap on a plastic processing cap). Then I rinse out with cool water. My hair is soft and easy to detangle. The smell is amazing. This has now become a part of my weekly wash routine. If you can find something that works definitely stick with it.
Good product. Today I just used this 3 minute deep conditioner as a leave in and I used some gel. My hair’s shiny, soft, and smells good. I attached an image.

I Love this conditioner. It does it's job real well . I mix it with some avocado , coconut oil, castor oil , peppermint oil, rice water and amla powder. Apply it all over my hair , cover with shower cap and then a scarf leave overnight and wash the next morning.

What's quarantine hair you ask.  For me it means getting an extra couple of hours of sleep and breaking my fragile long bleached blond locks as I sleep.  The back of my hair where my head meets the pillow has broken from waist long to inches long.  It needed help and fast.  First I stopped bleaching, I mean, heck who cares about my two inch grow out while we're sheltering in place.  Dogs and husband are sickening, but nobody else sees me.  So changed to a silky pillowcase and immediately went to Amazon for my old stand by conditioner.  I went to buy the moist version and ended up buying the deep conditioning instead.  Hair feels silky--even the three inch long locks!

I honestly don’t know how to feel about this. The smell is amazing but doesn’t last long. The softness is amazing as long as my hair is wet. For me, I’m a guy with an Afro. Washing my hair with a simple shampoo and conditioner with cold water automatically makes my hair curls. While I don’t know my hair type, my hair always comes out curly with some frizz. I bought this hoping it would get rid of the frizz which it did but the curls aren’t as defined anymore. It’s good and sort of bad at the same time for my experience. Also I did my research and apparently this has silicone with can potentially be bad for natural hair but I’ll keep using it and see how it comes out. And I don’t know if this is Mind over Matter but when I used this I got a slight headache I have not the slightest clue why.
Makes me hair soft asf! And I have coarse hair, love it. Dropped a pic to show what type of hair I have.
I have damaged, bleached hair and this product has made my hair go from coarse to super soft within a matter of weeks. I leave it on for about 3 minutes in the shower. Definitely will order again

This has been one of my favorite hair products of all time, I buy it faithfully when it runs out. It leaves my hair feeling a lot healthier and softer than when I didn't use it. I would go up and thank Aussie themselves if I could.

I’m usually a dove girl but this shampoo has changed my mind! Usually when I change shampoo my eczema flares up bad but this time nothing! This shampoo leaves my hair soft for days & my hair doesn’t get as oily so I can got two or three days without washing, i use it in my daughters hair & usually the next day her hair is all kinds of tangled from her curls. Using this shampoo has left her hair less tangled & more hydrated. I have also noticed I have had a decrease in hair loss since switching.

As an African American woman I dont like to change my hair care routine. I stick to products that work for me but when Pantene got rid of its relaxed and natural line, I didnt know what to do. I just stuck to Pantene(big mistake). It made my hair very dry and brittle. Now with Aussie I felt the difference while washing my hair. Made my hair feel soft and slick as opposed to hard and wet. I felt the moisture instantly!!!
