title: OGX Hydrating + Tea Tree Mint Shampoo, Nourishing & Invigorating Scalp Shampoo with Tea Tree & Peppermint Oil & Milk Proteins, Paraben-Free, Sulfate-Free Surfactants, 13 fl oz

reviews.review_text: Check resources before buying this. Other sites say to beware of products with Stay away from products that claim to be sulfate-free but contain the following ingredients: Cocamide DEA Cocamide MEA PEG’s, PEG8 Propylene Glycol Cocamidopropyl Betaine Hydroxysultain This has those!

I believe I got a fake product. I had borrowed my housemates shampoo and I loved it so much that I ordered the same one. Hers was bought in the store however. Once I began using my shampoo I noticed that the cream was mint green. I was confused as I didn’t remember my housemates shampoo being mint green. Then as I put it in my hair I felt that it smelled more like sweet candy cane. I smelled my housemates shampoo and it had a different smell to it. I then also put some of her shampoo in my hand and noticed that it was white, I also took some of my own shampoo and it was certainly mint green. Then I checked the bottles and my bottle said “made in Canada” while hers + all of her other 5 OGX bottles said “made in USA” Seeing other reviews photos in here and seeing that theirs says made in USA too means that some here seems to get fake shampoos of this product while others get the authentic one. Looking at one star reviews it seems like others have been unlucky too. Now I’m nervous how my hair will be after using this shampoo...others who got fake ones seems to have gotten very dry scalps. Which is unfortunate since I’ve been treating my dry scalp for a month now and it finally got better. Hoping I can get my money back, I am NOT happy.
reviews.review_title: Be aware of possibly getting a fake shampoo!

reviews.review_text: I have a hard time finding just the right shampoo for my long, ultra fine, super dry hair and oily scalp (such a fun combination isn't it?).  I've tried so many EXPENSIVE brands and I really do like Pureology, but decided to branch out and try something else.  I found this at a drug store and love the combo of mint and tea tree so I decided to give it a whirl.  6 months later I'm still using it and loving it, especially for the price!!  No it's not going to perform any hair miracles for you, but it is a lovely product that doesn't make my hair more dry or my scalp more oily.  I love the mild scent in the shower and no lingering aromas afterward.  My husband loves that it's a unisex fragrance that he can use too!  I bought both the shampoo and the condition as add on items and they're cheaper on Amazon than at Walmart that way.  Can't beat $4 (each) for a good shampoo and a good conditioner!  If you're looking for a solid product that won't break the bank (or your hair) I strongly recommend you give this brand a try!  I'm a big fan!  And yes, I pay full price for this product!
reviews.review_title: Great low cost product for my long, fine, dry hair and oily scalp!

reviews.review_text: I bought this because I found it on pinterest. Someone said it was a great shampoo for itchy scalps. I go through very itchy periods for some reason. It was getting really bad when I found this shampoo and decided to give it a try. I have tried many other shampoos and conditioners from this same brand and I love them all. This one was no exception. It really has helped my itchy scalp tremendously. I've really been very happy with this shampoo and this brand overall. Very highly recommend.

Be ready to relax and shampoo your woes away with this awesome aromatherapy essential shampoo. A lot of people think of peppermint as only something that is used during the winter, right before Christmas, perhaps, but this find is actually appropriate year-round. Use it in the winter when a combination of lack of humidity and the cold air will leave hair lifeless and dull from weather stress, and bring it back in summer to tame headaches and ease the tension in your neck after a long day at work. Lather, let it it sit, and then convince yourself to rinse away the tingle that comes from this shampoo. The tea tree oil will help keep dandruff at bay, and the peppermint makes your hair so soft! Used by beauticians everywhere. Once you experience the minty tingle, you won't want anything else to touch your tresses, so it's a good thing they have a conditioner that complements, down to being the same composition in a moisturizing, soothing formula. Fall in love, as I did.
Loved it at first, but then my scalp started to itch and burn. It seems to leave a coating on my hair that lingers. It drives my scalp and face crazy. The itch is awful!

The smell is sweet and lovely, I enjoyed it a lot. At home I always get organic, natural shampoos (that sometimes indeed don't wash well everytime, it's a hit or miss situation with "natural" shampoos) but I'm traveling and couldn't get my hands on my usual brand so tried this I've had it for about a month and finally connected the dots with why, for the first time in my life, the ends of my hair look dry... Nothing else has changed and I use a tiny amount to shampoo+ only on my roots but it still affects the lower parts of my hair, esp. right after washing, I'm not the only one reporting this. Quite disappointing

The tea tree and mint formula of this conditioner is really great (along with the matching shampoo) for oily itchy scalps.  I no longer have chronic itchy scalp thanks to this shampoo and conditioner.  However, it's a mediocre conditioner on the hair itself.  I have thick coarse hair and this conditioner does nothing to de-tangle or smooth out my hair strands.  I haven't had this problem with other conditioners before.  With this conditioner, I have to use a hair serum on my hair afterwards in order to de-tangle my hair so I can comb through it.  I'll stick with the shampoo, but I'm going to switch to a different conditioner.
reviews.review_title: Good for scalp but just ok for hair

reviews.review_text: Love OGX products usually but after buying this conditioner I'm a bit more weary. It says it's hydrating but lists multiple alcohols including rubbing alcohol which is very drying. I think it's probably used to enhance the mint smell and feel. After two uses my wavy, medium thickness hair is like straw though so the great mint smell just isn't worth it for me.

I've previously purchased this product from a brick-and-mortar store (both the shampoo and conditioner) and loved it! I decided to get a replacement through Amazon for convenience. I started to notice a lot of scalp buildup and oiliness in my hair after using this product, and I thought it was strange since I hadn't seen this previously. This persisted over multiple seasons/weather changes, and being inside most of the time, I didn't really think my environment would've been a contributing factor. I've read a lot about Amazon fulfillment combining counterfeit products with the actual seller's products, and I think it's possible that happened here. Two compelling reasons for this (aside from the effects mentioned above): 1) The bottle squeezes out an insane amount of product each time I use it (the size of a meatball almost). It's possible the top was just badly manufactured, but I haven't seen anything like this in previous OGX products. 2) There is not a strong "minty" smell or "minty" feel to the scalp. To me, this is one of the selling points of this conditioner, and it's not really noticeable with this product. 3) Hair doesn't really feel soft. Usually, when I use conditioner, my hair feels very soft when I'm letting it sit before rinsing - that doesn't seem to happen when I use this product. In fact, my hair almost feels dry after I shower. Fake or not, would just recommend being careful about purchasing beauty products on Amazon!  I've been an OGX fan in the past, so I thought this was an outlier when compared to my previous experiences.
reviews.review_title: Loved the formulation before, but think I received a fake - be careful w/ Amazon beauty products!
